Initially it could use elements such as cardboard, icopor, glass and brick to take samples that we can put in test tubes (they are economical) to which we would add vinegar in order not to change the liquid with which the experiment is being carried out or put other liquids such as soda, cleaning liquids (clorox-bleach) and rainwater to know the different effects of these liquids on each material. The experiment can be repeated using the same materials but at different temperatures (e.g. In the refrigerator, in the sun, etc.It can be repeated with the same materials but with different acids (e.g. citric acids, water with gas, etc.) You can repeat the experiment also by keeping the same acid but using different materials (e.g. iron, bone, meat-to introduce biological materials instead of physical materials, etc.and )
